A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
My enjoyment of the movie was nearly ruined by the online scuttlebutt (despite trying to avoid it).  I have followed Star Wars since the original (which i reviewed for a major metropolitan newspaper).  
There are some challenging concepts in Last Jedi but it was more faithful to the original trilogy ethos than the prequel trilogy.  It is essentially a mirror of Empire Strikes Back (which I recall also upsetting a number of Star Wars fans) and should hopefully set up a Return of the Jedi-type denouement.
Most complaints I've seen reflect viewers not having their preconceptions justified.
These movies\, after all\, are space opera - not 2001\, A Space Odyssey.
My wife - who is a film buff\, not a Star Wars aficionado - loved it as a movie.
